reviews.sentence: Good solid hotel. The good location right at the Metro is super reasonable overnight parking great place for event lifeguard at the pool very responsive staff. The reason I gave it three stars is because it was average it is a little worn around the edges curtains do not totally close cabinets are slightly broken bathroom is tired. But it is a really good DC option. And I love the a Hyat beds.
great hotel. Nice room with good amenities quiet comfortable beautiful lobby good restaurants friendly staff beautiful pool and spa in rooftop location. Terrific comedy show.
nearly perfect with indoor pool on the rofpay extra to park.

Affordable and suitable acomadations with great location near DC. Parking was 15 for Fri and Sat each good deal in this area. Pool and gym were nice additions. The hotel has a beautiful sunny atrium so there is a balcony outside your room. Nice to wake up to. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Prime location above the Metro. If you are looking for easy access to the city but want to stay in Bethesda this is your spot. Being located right above the metro makes it easy access to all points downtown. My kids love the pool on the top floor. Rooms were clean and staff was friendly.

Great Stay. This hotel was great. The staff here really seemed to care. I was here for 2 weeks and they took care of me well. The drinks at the hotel bar were great. Also the pool and health club are very nice. Breakfast is a bit pricey. Overall I would recommend to everyone.

Very pretty hotel in a convenient part of Bethesda. Having the metro stop directly below the hotel made commuting into DC very easy. The kids loved the pool on the top floor and the glass elevators. Staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean.

Best value and Super friendly staff. Staying here was a fantastic choice for our Family vacation to DC. It is so close to the Metro to get downtown there are restaurants everywhere within walking distance and there is a free bus that will take you also. We were greeted by the friendliest lady and all the staff throughout our stay were very friendly. The room was very nice and the pool has a lifeguard on duty at all times. This hotel was the best value of our whole trip and we will stay again when we go back to DC.

Nice hotel clean close to metro Washington DC. Very nice hotel close reasonable parking super convenient to metro. Pretty nice gym pool hot tub. Wish we did not have to have our air conditioner fixed three times. Mini fridge was a plus. Starbucks coffee in room was great.

hyat bethesda. very nice hotel. beautiful atrium very nice service. brunch not so hot. right in the middle of bethesday and right next to the metro station for easy access to public transportation. some very good deals available. very large pool on the top floor.

Decent but aged hotel. This is a typical Hyat but on the older side. Rooms in hotels should have accessible outlets in a room. I need to be able to charge my computer and phone. It was quite difficult to find a single outlet and none were near the bed of this small room. The TV was nice quality. Because of the open way that Hyats are built despite being on a middle floor I am currently listening to lobby bar noise floating up to my room at 1045 pm. The room service prices are quite high and it costs 18 to rent a movie excessive although the wifi is free. Overall a so so hotel and I will likely stay elsewhere next time.
Location design. The pool unknowingly closes from 10am5pm M F I had my son that was very disappointed. They never mentioned this in their advertising and i picked this hotel because of its pool.

Good stay annoyed at parking attendants. Our stay was great. A bit disappointed in how cold the rooftop pool was. But we found out they are closing it completely so that explains it. The only thing that annoys me is that my husband and I got charged 24 dollars for parking and my sister 12 and we were both there the same amount of time. Interesting.

False Promises. The good news. A few steps and you are in the subway station. Plenty of shops around french Cafe Madeleine very close for delicious breakfast next to a Safeway. Friendly and competent staff at the reception and a fine restaurant in the house also Mortons Steak house. Quiet room spacious plenty of storage room for the clothes. Big TV. We were comfortable there. Good price. But The bad news Coming from China for a whole week 8 nights. we were really looking forward to use the swimming pool and the whirlpool after the fitness training. When we looked for it we found out from a maid that there was no such thing must have been closed for some time. This was a big disappointment we would have not booked the hotel would we have known that. This should have been advisedThe rug in the room was filthy spots all over makes the room look so dirty. The rug really should be replaced. Furniture old doors to TV do not fit right. Missing a small table with two chairs to eat something available only one chair plus the desk. PS For USD 525 to wash 1 underpants we rather bought new ones for the next week in NY and washed all at home.

Nice location average hotel. I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on a business trip because of its location connected to a Metro stop ie you do not need an umbrella if it is raining walking distance to many nice restaurants and shops and a short Metro ride to NIH. Check in and check. out was fast. My room was on the top floor. It was quiet and clean. The bed was comfortable. There was a safe security box in the room which was good. Free wi fi worked well. There were two restaurants on the lobby level. I had dinner at one of them Excellent crab cakes which is what Maryland is known for. Am I going to stay here again. I am not sure. Hotel staff were profession but they did not make me feel welcomed. Everything in my room and hotel worked but nothing stood out. There was a gym with exercise equipments but there was no swimming pool. Bath towels were thin and cheep. My ranking for this hotel average.

Disappointed. Big room lots of space to put the clothes for two weeks. Friendly and competent reception. Good restaurant in the house plus Mortons Steak house. Quiet. Good value for the price. Safeway and very nice french cafe for breakfast only 5 minutes away. We were looking forward to use the pool daily the only reason why we did not take the other hotel near which I know and like. The pool was closed and we had not been advised of that. The rug in the room is filthy with all the spots a little table and another chair would have been fine not only the desk. All worn out old.

Construction ruined the experience. Hyat used to be my first choice for family vacations until now. Beware this hotel is currently under heavy renovation both inside and outside. it is like staying at a construction site. I am attaching some pictures to give you some idea. No front driveway no lobby no atrium no pool dusty garage no bellboy to help us unload luggage. And to top it off you hear jackhammers working 9 am to 4 pm daily. I booked two rooms directly from the Hyat website and even talked to them two days before arrival to confirm. I was not informed in any way that the hotel was under massive renovation. I understand this old hotel needs renovating but it is NOT okay not to disclose it to your guests beforehand. Seeing such a mess was a total shock to me when we arrived. My elderly father was looking forward to meeting up with some old high school friends and relaxing at the hotel the next day. Instead he was told to expect loud construction noises for 7 hours. We talked to a few other guests at the hotel and they were very unhappy as well. I would like to give thanks to Neil the manager here. He tried very hard to accommodate my dads reunion. He arranged a quieter location on a higher floor for my dad and his friends to carry on a conversation comfortably. The first star I offer here is just for Neil. The second star is for the location of the hotel. It is right above the Bethesda Metro station and is within walking distance to lots of restaurants and a grocery store Safeway. A gas station is within a couple of blocks. This hotel does not deserve any more star in the current situation. The room is old and very basic. They did not do a good job cleaning the bathroom either. Maybe after the renovation the hotel will be more appealing. But how Hyat handled the current situation was very disappointing. They should have been truthful about the hotels current state on their web site. They should have allowed potential customers to make an informed decision. You can not just lure your guest in using old pictures and then give them a handout at check in apologizing for the inconvenience. It is just not an honest way to do business.

Nice but WARNING construction amenities lacking. Stayed 4 nights Saturday through Wednesday. Called directly to hotel in advance to check on pool since this is a requirement in humid over 10degre DC summer weather. Unfortunately misinformed. We have stayed here in past and was always wonderful. This time taxi could not find entrance none now accessible pool and Jacuzi closed massive construction with loud disruptive noise. There is still a fitness center open. During stay without warning water was turned off in middle of day should at least have slipped a note under door in advance. Now this is a great location with Bethesda metro stop right at the hotel terrific restaurants including Mortons and very nice staff working under difficult circumstances. There is a Dunkin Donuts near metro stop and a Safeway grocery store around the corner from that. The rooms are large free wifi refrigerator comfy beds. Just be warned to ask appropriate questions for what you require in a hotel while under construction. They were kind enough to discount our stay by a minimal amount.

Nightmare hotel under renovation with no notice. no pool no lobby tiny room. I have stayed at this hotel before and had a wonderful experience. Unfortunately the hotel is under construction and the soaring atrium is closed and so is the bar the pool the club lounge everything. The hotel is surrounded by a fence in the front and we did not even know how to enter the hotel at first. Also the room was tiny barely bigger than the bed. I spoke to the general manager and the most he was willing to do was an upgrade on my next stay. Also he said that there is noticeable the reservation on the website but in order to find that notice you have to scroll down one page and it is in tiny print. This is extremely deceptive. I am sure everything will be great when the hotel construction is finished but for now I can not recommend this property.

Very clean and nice place to stay. We were wanting a place to stay that was convenient for a Washington DC vacation. This is the place to stay. The Metro train station is right outside the hotel and is accessible from the hotel elevators. Could not be any better for commuting int DC to see the sights. If anyone asked where we stayed I will definently tell the the Hyat Recency in Bethesda. The ONLY way it could have been any better is if the hotel had a pool for it is customers.
